events.originalText: Same-sex marriage in Australia became legal as the Marriage Amendment (Definition and Religious Freedoms) Act 2017 came into effect.
events.subtitle: Same-sex marriage in Australia
events.headline: Australia Legalizes Same-Sex Marriage

events.originalText: Park Geun-hye, the president of South Korea, was impeached, marking the culmination of the country's political scandal.
events.subtitle: Park Geun-hye
events.headline: South Korean President Park Geun-hye Impeached

events.originalText: Governor of Illinois Rod Blagojevich was arrested for a number of corruption crimes, including attempting to sell the U.S. Senate seat that was being vacated by then-President-elect Barack Obama.
events.subtitle: Rod Blagojevich
events.headline: Illinois Governor Rod Blagojevich Arrested for Corruption

events.originalText: Mumia Abu-Jamal was arrested for the murder of Philadelphia police officer Daniel Faulkner; his subsequent conviction and death sentence generated controversy in the United States.
events.subtitle: Mumia Abu-Jamal
events.headline: Mumia Abu-Jamal Arrested for Murder of Police Officer

events.originalText: A World Health Organization commission of scientists certified the global eradication of smallpox, making it the only human infectious disease to date to have been completely eradicated.
events.subtitle: World Health Organization
events.headline: WHO Certifies Global Eradication of Smallpox

events.originalText: U.S. secretary of state William P. Rogers proposed a plan, later called the Rogers Plan, for a ceasefire in the War of Attrition; Egypt's and Jordan's acceptance of the plan over Palestine Liberation Organization objections led to civil war in Jordan in September 1970.
events.subtitle: William P. Rogers
events.headline: U.S. Secretary of State Proposes Rogers Plan for Ceasefire

events.originalText: Douglas Engelbart gave what became known as "The Mother of All Demos", publicly debuting the computer mouse (pictured), hypertext, and the bit-mapped graphical user interface using the oN-Line System (NLS).
events.subtitle: Douglas Engelbart
events.headline: Douglas Engelbart Debuts Computer Mouse and GUI

events.originalText: A large, brilliant fireball was seen by thousands in midwestern North America before crash landing in Kecksburg, Pennsylvania.
events.subtitle: Kecksburg UFO incident
events.headline: Fireball Seen in North America Crashes in Pennsylvania

events.originalText: Tanganyika Territory gained independence from Britain before becoming part of Tanzania three years later.
events.subtitle: Tanganyika Territory
events.headline: Tanganyika Territory Gains Independence

events.originalText: The United Nations General Assembly adopted the Genocide Convention, which defines genocide in legal terms and advises its signatories to prevent and punish such actions.
events.subtitle: United Nations General Assembly
events.headline: UN Adopts Genocide Convention

events.originalText: Second World War: British and Commonwealth forces began Operation Compass, the first major Allied military operation of the Western Desert campaign.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied Forces Begin Operation Compass in WWII

events.originalText: First World War: Hussein al-Husayni, the Ottoman mayor of Jerusalem, surrendered the city to British forces (pictured).
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Jerusalem Surrendered to British Forces in WWI

events.originalText: A mine explosion near Briceville, Tennessee, killed 84 miners despite a well-organized rescue effort led by the United States Bureau of Mines.
events.subtitle: Cross Mountain Mine disaster
events.headline: Mine Explosion in Tennessee Kills 84 Miners

events.originalText: Legislation establishing state secularism in France was passed by the Chamber of Deputies.
events.subtitle: 1905 French law on the Separation of the Churches and the State
events.headline: France Passes Legislation Establishing State Secularism

events.originalText: French actress, journalist and leading suffragette Marguerite Durand founded the feminist newspaper La Fronde.
events.subtitle: Marguerite Durand
events.headline: Marguerite Durand Found Feminist Newspaper La Fronde

events.originalText: The English association football club Newcastle United was founded by the merger of Newcastle East End and West End.
events.subtitle: Association football
events.headline: Newcastle United Football Club Founded

events.originalText: The first edition of the Argosy magazine was published under the title The Golden Argosy.
events.subtitle: Argosy (magazine)
events.headline: First Edition of Argosy Magazine Published

events.originalText: In a memoir read to the French Academy of Sciences, Augustin-Jean Fresnel coined the terms linear, circular, and elliptical polarization, and reported a direct refraction experiment verifying his theory that optical rotation is a form of birefringence.
events.subtitle: French Academy of Sciences
events.headline: Fresnel Introduces Polarization Terms and Theory

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: After their loss in the Battle of Great Bridge, British authorities were forced to evacuate from the Colony of Virginia.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British Authorities Evacuate Virginia After Battle

events.originalText: In the only substantial military action in England during the Glorious Revolution, forces loyal to William of Orange were decisively victorious in the Battle of Reading.
events.subtitle: Glorious Revolution
events.headline: William of Orange Forces Victorious in Battle of Reading
